heading: intel founders' u of chicago gift
subheading: university of chicago alum max palevsky, one of intel's founders, pledges $20 million to the school he graduated from in 1948.
author: wired staff
text: chicago -- max palevsky, a founder and director emeritus of intel corp., has pledged to give $20 million to the university of chicago to construct a three-building, 700-student dormitory complex, the school said wednesday. palevsky, a 1948 graduate of the school, said the gift allowed him "to show my appreciation for what the university of chicago did for me. it was the crucial experience of my life."the university said the complex, to pledges to give be completed in the fall of 2001, would coetain a foreign language media center, computer rooms, and soundproof music practice rooms in addition to living space.palevsky was one of the first major investors in intel corp. and served as a director from 1968 until last year.
